learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate effective communication techniques to facilitate person-centred dental practice
Critically reflect on dental practice experiences understanding multiple perspectives and context
Explain the aetiology of major oral diseases and apply principles of minimal intervention dentistry
Demonstrate emerging manual dexterity skills applying the principles of minimal intervention dentistry
Conduct a comprehensive clinical examination of the oral cavity and associated structures in a simulated setting.
Apply frameworks to formulate evidence-based preventive management plans for dental caries.
Demonstrate an applied knowledge of direct restorative materials and their properties.

assessments.task_description:
This formative assessment task takes the form of cavity preparation tasks using equipment/instrumentation and the LearnaPrep block. Students will also provide a self-assessment of performance to demonstrate reflection and understanding of manual dexterity, handpiece handling, and safe practice. The practical assessment will be conducted in the laboratory setting under timed conditions during a designated class session. Students will be given time to set up for the practical assessment in the laboratory setting.

The assessment must be completed unassisted by supervisors; students have ninety (90) minutes to complete two (2) preparations in their LearnaPrep blocks according to supplied specifications, while demonstrating a consistently high standard of laboratory PPE compliance, handpiece handling, and safe operations. The self-assessment will be completed during the timed conditions after the student has completed their cavity preparations.

Students will have opportunities to practise cavity preparation techniques and self-evaluation and will be able to receive feedback for practice from supervisors during the semester, and leading up to the assessment.
assessments.submission_guidelines: After 90 minutes allowed to complete the specified preparations and to self-assess those preparations, students will leave the venue while examiners evaluate the work presented. When marking is completed and blocks are returned, students may seek individual feedback on their performance from examiners once they collect their LearnaPrep blocks, and will be able to compare their self-assessment with that of the examiners.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: There is no late submission allowed for this assessment.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
This summative assessment task takes the form of cavity preparation tasks using equipment/instrumentation and the Typodont model. Students will be assessed on the performance to demonstrate satisfactory performance of manual dexterity skills and handpiece handling. The practical assessment will be conducted in the laboratory setting under timed conditions during a designated class session. Students will be given time to set up for the practical assessment in the laboratory setting.

The assessment must be completed unassisted by supervisors; students have ninety (90) minutes to complete a single (1) preparation in their Typodont model, on the indicated tooth number (e.g. tooth 36) according to supplied specifications, while demonstrating a consistently high standard of laboratory PPE compliance, handpiece handling, and safe operations.

Students will have opportunities to practise cavity preparation techniques and will be able to receive feedback for practice from supervisors during the semester, and leading up to the assessment.
assessments.submission_guidelines: After the 90 minutes allowed to complete the specified preparation, students will leave the venue while examiners evaluate the work presented. When marking is completed and models returned, students may seek individual feedback on their performance from examiners once they collect their Typodont model.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: There is no late submission allowed for this assessment.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
This assessment takes the form of an Objective Structured Clinical Examination. Students are assessed on their performance of several specified procedures which they have learned by completing the Simulation Peer Clinic session Learning Activities during the semester in the DENT1061 course.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: This assessment is being completed under examination conditions. Students must arrive on time or will not be permitted to complete the assessment task. No unpermitted materials to be brought into the assessment. Any evidence of misconduct or cheating will result in referral to the Academic Integrity Officer.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: There is no late submission for this assessment.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
A sixty (60) minute examination containing multiple choice and short answer questions covering all of the course learning material delivered for a possible sixty (60) marks. This is a MUST PASS assessment item (achieve a minimum of 50% to pass). Supplementary assessment is available for this item (in accordance with PPL Assessment Procedure Section 3 Part J).

Learning material covered in the examination:

  • Medical histories
  • Dental records and charting
  • Intraoral and extraoral examination
  • Principles of prevention in dental practice
  • Non-carious tooth loss
  • Dental caries: etiology, clinical and radiographic identification, risk assessment and classification, conservative management
  • Moisture control and isolation
  • Occlusal analysis for restoration
  • Principles of cavity preparation
  • Intracoronal dental restorative materials, selection rationale, related restorative armamentarium
assessments.submission_guidelines: The exam will be completed in Inspera Assessment using Safe Exam Browser (SEB) Please ensure that you have already downloaded Safe Exam Browser (SEB) to your computer. You can do this by visiting https://web.library.uq.edu.au/library-services/it/learnuq-blackboard-help/inspera-assessment/safe-exam-browser-inspera and completing the steps to install the application (Windows or MacOS) and test it on your computer by completing a preparation test. On exam day you will be provided with instructions on how to access your exam via the Safe Exam Browser (SEB) application.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 13(28 Jul - 02 Nov)
learning_activities.topic:
Clinical Coaching Sessions (F2F)

Learning sessions includes various topics, such as: etiology/investigation/diagnosis of caries, management of caries including removal, rationale and application of isolation, restorative materials, etc.

Further detailed timetables will be available on the Blackboard course site.
learning_activities.topic_description: Clinical Coaching Sessions (F2F) Learning sessions includes various topics, such as: etiology/investigation/diagnosis of caries, management of caries including removal, rationale and application of isolation, restorative materials, etc. Further detailed timetables will be available on the Blackboard course site.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 13(28 Jul - 02 Nov)
learning_activities.topic:
Pre-clinic

A series of sessions in the preclinical simulation laboratory will be delivered: safe dental practice, introduction to restorative equipment and instruments, caries management based practical sessions, application techniques for restorative materials.

Further detailed timetables will be available on the Blackboard course site. Attendance is compulsory.
learning_activities.topic_description: Pre-clinic A series of sessions in the preclinical simulation laboratory will be delivered: safe dental practice, introduction to restorative equipment and instruments, caries management based practical sessions, application techniques for restorative materials. Further detailed timetables will be available on the Blackboard course site. Attendance is compulsory.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 13(28 Jul - 02 Nov)
learning_activities.topic:
Peer Clinic

Clinical activities/training sessions: students will be expected to apply their theoretical knowledge and practical skills learnt throughout the coaching and pre-clinic session into the clinical sessions, under the supervision of a dental practitioner. Clinical learning will be recorded in a log book throughout the semester. Attendance is compulsory
